com.infoengine.util

Class LanguagePreference

  • java.lang.Object
    • BaseLanguagePreference
      • com.infoengine.util.LanguagePreference

  • public final class LanguagePreference
extends BaseLanguagePreference
    LanguagePreference contains methods used to parse HTTP Accept-Language strings and retrieve the 'sub-parts' of the strings. These methods are for use when localizing a response to a client HTTP request.

    Supported API: true
    Extendable: false

      • getAcceptLanguagePreferences

        @Deprecated
public static java.util.Vector getAcceptLanguagePreferences(java.lang.String acceptLanguageString)
                                                                 throws IEException
        Deprecated. 
        Parses an HTTP Accept-Language string and returns a Vector of String representations of languages in order of decreasing preference.

        Supported API: true
        Parameters:
        acceptLanguageString - Language preferences expressed in HTTP Accept-Language header value format
        Returns:
        Vector of String representations of languages in order of descending preference
        Throws:
        IEException - Never actually thrown; declared purely for backwards compilation compatibility
        See Also:
        getAcceptLanguageLocales(java.lang.String)

      • getAcceptLanguageLocales

        public static java.util.List<java.util.Locale> getAcceptLanguageLocales(java.lang.String acceptLanguageString)
        Parses an HTTP Accept-Language header string and returns a list of Locale objects in order of decreasing preference,

        Supported API: true
        Parameters:
        acceptLanguageString - Language preferences expressed in HTTP Accept-Language header value format
        Returns:
        List of Locale objects in order of decreasing preference

      • getLocale

        @Deprecated
public static java.util.Locale getLocale(java.util.Vector<?> preferences)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the Locale object for the most preferred language (based solely on the input). In other words, it builds the Locale object for the first element in the given Vector object. If the Vector is empty, the default locale is returned.

        Supported API: true
        Parameters:
        preferences - A Vector of languages from an HTTP request's Accept-Language header as provided by getAcceptLanguageLocales(java.lang.String) or getAcceptLanguagePreferences(java.lang.String)
        Returns:
        The preferred Locale
        See Also:
        getLocale(java.lang.String), getLocale(java.util.Collection)

      • getLocale

        public static java.util.Locale getLocale(java.util.Collection<?> preferences)
        Returns the Locale object for the most preferred language (based solely on the input). In other words, it builds the Locale object for the first element in the given collection. If the collection is empty, the default locale is returned.

        Supported API: true
        Parameters:
        preferences - An ordered collection of languages from an HTTP request's Accept-Language header as provided by getAcceptLanguageLocales(java.lang.String) or getAcceptLanguagePreferences(java.lang.String)
        Returns:
        The preferred Locale

      • getLocale

        public static java.util.Locale getLocale(java.lang.String acceptLanguageString)
        Returns the Locale object for the most preferred language (based solely on the input). If the string is null or empty, the default locale is returned.

        Supported API: true
        Parameters:
        acceptLanguageString - An HTTP request's Accept-Language header value
        Returns:
        The preferred Locale

      • getEncoding

        public static java.lang.String getEncoding(java.util.Locale locale)
        Returns the url encoding for the specified locale.

        Supported API: true
        Parameters:
        locale - Current locale
        Returns:
        url encoding expected.
